author: bridge-bot
content: <KolbyML> @gr3999 using `lean-quickstart` do you guys expect each node to run one validator? or how do you guys specify which validator_id's belong to which node?

author: bridge-bot
content:
<ch4r10t33r> re: **@KolbyML**
> @gr3999 using lean-quickstart do you guys expect each node to run one validator? or how do you guys specify which validator_id's belong to which node?
Yes, one validator per node. All of this is defined in validator-config.yaml (https://github.com/blockblaz/lean-quickstart/blob/main/local-devnet/genesis/validator-config.yaml)

author: bridge-bot
content:
<gr3999> 1. in term of validator indices, you can specify how many you want to allocate to a node in validator-config (`count` yaml property)
    - all the counts are summed up to get the total validator count for the genesis
    - those many keypairs are generated and a `validator-keys-manifest.yaml` is also generated, format shared in the repo's readme.md)
    - `activeEpoch` for key's lifetime is picked again from validator-config.yaml
    - `config.yaml` is also generated, for devnet0 the total `count` is dumped there as num_validators I think), will get it updated to have genesis-validators propertly to list all the pub keys for the genesis so that its handy for the clients to generate it

2. PK's genesis generator generates validators.yaml that actually assigns the indices, the nodes are supposed to pick their indices from the file as the `node-key` is passed to the nodes via their `client-cmds` arg script
